meta.content: Texas Governor Greg Abbott has announced that schools are to remain closed down for the remainder of the school year. Venus ISD will continue to provide on-line education through May 20. In the...

div.font: Texas Governor Greg Abbott has announced that schools are to remain closed down for the remainder of the school year. Venus ISD will continue to provide on-line education through May 20. In the meantime, school officials are already making plans for next school year.

td.div: Many changes have occurred over the past few weeks, but we want to do everything we can to ensure that your child continues learning. Please check out the Venus ISD At-Home Learning Plan for the 6th Six Weeks via the link below. Each teacher is working diligently to prepare instruction for their students, and you should have received information from your child's teacher about assignments and daily schedules. If you have any questions, please contact your child's teacher or the campus principal.

div.span: If your student is in need of tech support,

br.span: If your students doesn't remember usernames or passwords, please contact their teacher.

td.div:
According to the Center for Disease Control, the best way to prevent illness is to avoid being exposed to the virus. To stay healthy:
Wash your hands often
Avoid close contact with people who are sick
Stay home if you're sick
Cover coughs and sneezes
Wear a facemask if you're sick
Clean and disinfect frequently touched surfaces daily Click the link below to learn more from the CDC.

div.span: Beginning Tuesday, April 14, we will only be serving meals 1 day per week from 10:30 AM to Noon at Venus Elementary School. All other meal pick up locations will be closed after meals are served on April 9. After April 14th, meal service will be on Monday of each week throughout the remainder of the school year. Each week, we will give each student enough lunch meals to last them through all of the scheduled school days for that week. Meal service is for children aged 18 and under, and the children must be present in the vehicle to receive meals. Please remember to refrigerate meals until they are consumed, and if the food should be heated, heat them to an internal temperature of 160 F to ensure it is safe to consume.

div.span: The Master Facility Planning Committee will not be meeting until further notice.

td.div:
​Enrolling or Withdrawing Students
Please contact Deanne Nettik at deanne.nettik@venusisd.net or
call 972-366-3448 ext. 2106
All enrollments and withdrawals will go through the office of Deanne Nettik during our time of remote instruction.

div.span:
Inscripción o retiro de estudiantes
Por favor, póngase en contacto con Deanne Nettik

br.br:
​Llame al 972-366-3448 y use la extensión 2106
Todas las inscripciones y retiros pasan por la oficina de Deanne Nettik durante nuestro tiempo de instrucción remota.
​

span.strong: What do I do if I have been exposed to or diagnosed with COVID-19?
span.br: To report a confirmed exposure to COVID-19, please email

div.span:
.
If you have a question about how local, state, or national COVID-19 response has affected your child's education, please email it to

div.strong: Why haven't I heard from the school?
div.br:
We have attempted to contact each family. If you have not been contacted, it likely means that the contact information we have on file for you is out of date. Please call Mrs. Deanne Nettik at 972-366-3448 ext 2106, or email her at deanne.nettik@venusisd.net, so we can review your family's contact information. Llame a la Sra. Jessica Acevedo al 972-366-3448 ext 6107 o envíele un correo electrónico a jessica.acevedo@venusisd.net, para que podamos revisar la información de contacto de su familia.
​

div.div:
What do I do when my child's school-issued technology isn't working?
Our Technology Department is fully operational and will work any technology issue you may have. For instructions on how to submit a technology help request, click the link below.

div.font: The Venus ISD Tip Line is a great way to share kudos, concerns, or other feedback with district administrators. You can share anonymously, or if you choose to share your name and contact information, we can begin a dialogue with you about your issue.

span.font: Great things are happening at VISD

td.div: Click the link below to view live streams of our events. We live stream a variety of activities, including school board meetings, campus assemblies, graduation, and even sporting events. If the event is being live streamed, the stream will be accessible via the link below.

blockquote.font: Venus ISD serves 2033 students and is located 25 miles south of the Dallas-Fort Worth Metroplex. Once a rural farming area, Venus has grown into a small suburban community. The Venus Independent School District has been committed to providing excellence in education for its students since it was founded in 1914.

td.div:
Venus ISD: 100 Student Dr Venus, TX 76084 Phone: 972-366-3448 Fax: 972-232-2141
​​To report errors or issues with the website, please email webmaster@venusisd.net
